row.column: Removes the autocomplete instance and its bindings, how to use: const auto = new Autocomplete('id', {...}); auto.destroy();

This method allows you to re-render the results without modifying the input field.
If we pass text rerender(string); then we render the results again and also replace the text in the input field.

This method allows you to disable the autocomplete functionality.
const auto = new Autocomplete('id', {...}); auto.disable(); then we disable the autocomplete. To remove input value you need to call auto.disable(true); Example: disable

This method allows you to re-enable the autocomplete functionality after using disable().
const auto = new Autocomplete('id', {...}); auto.disable(); then we disable the autocomplete. To re-enable it you need to call auto.enable(); Example: enable/disable toggle, enable/disable with empty input
